description.narrative: 1. Farmer Incomes: The Project is expected to improve farmer incomes in SSA through job creation for seedproducing contract farmers, most of whom are smallholders. Farmers in SSA will also benefit from betterquality planting material, which has the potential to significantly increase cotton yields in small holder farmsand reduce losses due to pest attacks, thus increasing farmer income. The Project is also expected to limithealth risks for cotton farmers as the use of insect tolerant seeds reduces the need for pesticides. 2. Food Security: The Company's high quality rice seeds are expected to result in 30-50% yield improvementsfor rice, a critical component of South-East Asian diets thus improving food security and benefiting end consumers.

Maharashtra Hybrid Seed Company Ltd (Mahyco India or the Sponsor) is one of Indias leading seed producers and was the first to introduce hybrid seeds for millets, wheat, sorgrum, maize and sunflower and the first to commercialize insect tolerant cotton in India. Mahyco Indias subsidiary, Mahyco International Pte Ltd (Mahyco International or the Company) incorporated in Singapore, is the holding company for the Sponsors international operations and owns operating entities that sell cotton seeds in Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) and rice seeds in Vietnam and Bangladesh. The Company seeks to invest US$26 million to expand its cotton business in SSA and to expand its rice and eggplant business in Asia (the Project).

name.narrative: The Project compromises funding the technology costs, working capital needs, pre-commercialization costs and capex in several countries in SSA including Nigeria, Malawi, Kenya, Zambia, Tanzania and Burkina Faso and in Asia (including Bangladesh, Vietnam, Indonesia, the Philippines, Laos and Cambodia).
